metadata.title: CVE-2017-14737 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A cryptographic cache-based side channel in the RSA implementation in Botanbefore 1.10.17, and 1.11.x and 2.x before 2.3.0, allows a local attacker torecover information about RSA secret keys, as demonstrated by CacheD. Thisoccurs because an array is indexed with bits derived from a secret key.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14737` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libbotan-1.10-0 - 1.10.5-1+deb7u1ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: botan1.10 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.5-1+deb7u1ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1').
